page.title: 01Burnham Thorpe
page.content: Nelsons Country A typical rural Norfolk countryside gentle undulating farmland, highly cultivated agriculture dominates all the landscape, it is vast. Fields stretching to horizon, the sky is limitless the air is fresh and clean. The north wind brings a smell of ozone the small village of Burnham Thorpe is much the same as it was in Nelsons time. The population is steadily declining, holiday homes account for 15% of housing stock, some 35% of population are above 60 years old. Working population very small, agricultural and services, the village is typical example of rural decline
